item.title: Concerned Citizen’s Call Leads to Arrest in Brigus Junction
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description:
Oh me nerves, b'y, ye won't believe the yarn I’ve got for ya from Bridgus Junction. So, looks like ol’ Donald Gillingham, who's a real beaut from Holyrood, was caught snoozing behind the wheel of his car. Some good-hearted soul thought he was in trouble and called the Mounties. But turns out, before the coppers even got there, ol’ Don managed to tap another car with his.
Now here's the kicker – when they did catch up with him, he wouldn't take a breath test. Smart move, eh? Apparently, he's got a knack for this sorta thing, with two other refusals and an impaired driving charge already on his record. The man's like a broken record, playing the same tune over and over. Anyways, he's off to court again on August 12th. Maybe this time he’ll get the message, but I’m not holding my breath!

item.title: Musgrave Harbour Evacuation Order Lifted After Nearly a Week

media:content.media:description: Chance Harbour access map (Government of Newfoundland and Labrador)

item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description:
Well, let me tell ya somethin’ b’ys, folks in Musgrave Harbour finally made it back home after nearly a week of campin’ out somewhere else ‘cause of that wildfire that was knockin’ on everyone’s doorstep. Public Safety Minister John Haggie’s givin’ a tip of the hat to the crews for battlin’ the beast under what he calls “extraordinary conditions.” I mean, 40 millimetres of rain didn’t make a lick of difference to the fire, if ya can imagine! Sounds like it was tearin' through there like Aunt Martha after last call at the Legion.
But hold onto your hats for a sec—there’s still some hot spots being worked on, so don’t be surprised if you catch a whiff of smoke every now and then. Meanwhile, the poor cabin owners over in Chance Harbour can finally get a peek at their places, just be sure to check that map ‘cause some spots are still no-go zones. Honestly, this whole thing feels like we’re in a movie or somethin’, but at least folks are safely back home where they can have a mug up and relax—well, as much as you can with a forest fire in your backyard!

item.title: Outer Ring Road Section to Close Sunday for St. John’s Triathlon
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description: Well, b'y, looks like the Outer Ring Road's gettin' a bit of a nap tomorrow, eh? They're shuttin' 'er down—at least the westbound bits from Portugal Cove Road over to Thorburn Road. That Bennett's Road fella's takin' a break too from 7 in the mornin' 'til 2 in the arvo, all 'cause of the St. John's Triathlon. Like, sure, I'll just take me helicopter instead, no biggie! At least they're puttin' up some signs to keep folks from wanderin' off track. But fair enough, I s'pose, let the fit folks have their day. Just hope the moose takes the day off from crossin' the roads too, eh?

item.title: Beer Run Leads to Arrest, Charges for Marystown Man
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description: Oh me nerves, b'ys, listen to this: Curtis Foote from Marystown decided it'd be a grand idea to nick a case of beer and some other stuff from the Ultramar gas bar round 2 in the mornin'. Now, I don't know 'bout you, but that's a bit early even for a Bay Roberts breakfast, eh? Anyway, our young Einstein tries to leg it, but them RCMP lads weren't havin' any of it. They nabbed him nearby after he tossed his loot and tried bein' Usain Bolt for a sec. So now he's got a laundry list of charges: theft under $5,000, resisting arrest, and not listenin' to his last slap on the wrist. Gonna be seein' the judge later, I s'pose. Maybe he shoulda stuck to fishin'. At least ya can't get arrested for catchin' a cold cod.

item.title: Woman Charged with Assault, Theft After Centre City Disturbance
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description: Well b'ys, seems like there's no shortage of entertainment in downtown St. John's these days! Some 41-year-old lass decided to start a ruckus at a business there, and now she's got herself a sleepover at the lockup. Charged with assault, theft under $5000, and breach of probation – sounds like she was on a real tear, eh? She's off to see the judge today, so let's see if she gets a slap on the wrist or a reminder that actions have consequences. I tell ya, some folks just seem determined to keep the Royal Newfoundland Constabulary on their toes!

item.title: New Speed Cameras Go Live, Fourth Planned for Larkhall Street
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description:
Well, b'ys, the province is gettin' fancy on us with three new speed cameras startin' up. Two on the Veterans Memorial and one near St. Mary's Elementary on Waterford Bridge Road in town. And there's another on the way near schools on Larkhall Street – all to stop folks from tearin' down the road like it's the Targa rally. The minister, Sarah Stoodley, is chattin' up crossing guards and reckonin' these cameras'll have everyone restin' easy, since apparently speeders are runnin' amok in school zones.
They're tellin' us they picked these spots after chewin' the fat with everyone from the RNC to some fancy camera company, Jenoptik Smart Mobility or some such name. They're gonna roll this out in stages, ten cameras first off, and spread 'em around to construction zones and schools like butter on toast. And aye, they’ll even slap some on school bus stop-arms to catch eejits who don’t stop for the bus. Good grief, next they'll have a camera in me skidoo trails catchin' me for going a bit heavy on the throttle. But if it keeps the wee nippers safe, I s'pose it ain't too bad.

item.title: Harbour Grace Regatta Postponed to Sunday
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description: Ah, b'y, looks like the Harbour Grace Regatta's gone and got itself pushed to tomorrow. They were thinkin' about havin' it today, but with all that rain comin' down they figured it'd be a right soggy mess. Can't be havin' the boats floatin' on rain instead of water, now can we? So they're givin' it a go tomorrow instead. Supposed to be a beauty of a day they'll have then – sunshine and warmth with a nice light breeze. Only in Newfoundland would we have to wait for the weather to make up its mind, eh? Hopefully, it shows up like the forecast says this time!

item.title: Man Charged with Sexual Assault in St. John’s
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description:
Well, b'ys, it looks like we’ve got more trouble on the go in St. John’s. A fellah, 47 years old, got himself hauled up by the cops for sexual assault over in the west end last night. The RNC got the call just before 8 o'clock. Ain’t that a lovely way to spend your evening?
Not only is he facing sexual assault charges, but they’ve also slapped on assault, uttering threats, and breach of probation for good measure. Sounds like he was busy, eh? They kept him in custody overnight, probably to cool his head before seeing the judge.
Suppose jury duty’s gonna be real popular this season—nothing like a bit of local scandal to keep everyone on their toes. Bet the gossip was flying faster than seagulls in a windstorm this morning. Lord, keep us safe from the jaw-droppers, I say.

item.title: Public Warning Issued for Missing Opioids in Corner Brook
item.dc:creator: Beth Fagan
item.description: Oh me nerves, b'ys! Seems the folks at the hospitable in Corner Brook have gone and lost themselves a right dangerous crate. Some kind of liquid dope called remifentanil, that's more potent than a winter's gale, might be floating around now. You only need a sniff of the stuff and you're liable to keel over and meet your maker. If anyone's seen hide nor hair of it, they're asking folks to give the RNC a ring or talk to the Crime Stoppers. I tell ya, it's like they sent the Tibb's Eve crew to do Christmas Day's work!

item.title: NLHS Provides Look at New Morgue Facility
item.dc:creator: Linda Swain
item.description:
Oh b'y, did ya hear 'bout the big to-do over at the Health Sciences Centre? They just opened up the fancy new digs for the morgue. Yep, they’ve gone from fit only 12 bodies to a whopping 96 now! I'd say that’s a bit of an upgrade, wouldn't ya think?
Turns out, the old holding place was built way back in 1972 and was gettin’ so crowded they had to haul in them portable freezer units last year. Had everyone up in arms, it did! Some folks were fit to be tied over that one.
But don’t worry, they’ve spruced it up now with a purpose-built space. Even got it all separated out between the NL Health Services and the Chief Medical Examiner's Office. Apparently, it's all part of some lab modernization project. It’s nice to know our province is thinking about the future... I just hope they don't end up needing all 96 spots anytime soon, else we got bigger problems!
